intro: Stomatium beaufortense, commonly known as the Beaufort Stomachwort, is a rare flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats and is adapted to cold climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine pubescence. Stomatium beaufortense plays a minor role in local ecosystems but is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique adaptations.
